I think I understand what you and April are saying Frank - I think I was ju=
st confused because words like 'proof' are used in so many ways.=C2=A0 Ther=
e is scientific proof (which basically means that collected data, observati=
ons, and experimental results conform to given theories) and personal proof=
 (which is whatever it takes for a person, personally, to believe something=
, regardless of what anyone else says, sort of like with religion).=C2=A0 I=
 thought you all were talking about the former, but I see that you both mea=
nt the latter.=C2=A0 I can offer advice to improve EVP testing as far as sc=
ientific proof, but as I think you've shown, there is no need for me to sug=
gest anything for helping along personal proof.

But my offer still stands =
if you'd ever be interested in exposing your experiences to a more formal p=
rocess, and trying to create a team, with you as the tech expert, to bring =
these studies to the next phase.



--- On Mon, 5/4/09, Frank Sumption <pur=
plealiengirl@...> wrote:

From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@gmail=
.com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: People given a grant to do what you all ar=
e doing,
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Monday, May 4, 2009, 12:34 PM


=









    
            
            


      
      =C2=A0Medical Scienc=
e!? Really!? Are you FN kidding me!? A "science" that is directly responsib=
le for the deaths and suffering of hundreds of thousands every year by the =
use of drugs and practices that suppsedly underwent these bogus studies for=
 safety and effectiveness. That's your example of science? Where's the "sci=
ence" when you can make these studies show whatever you want, or whatever s=
omeone paid for?=C2=A0 Science is a big fat lie! 

=C2=A0
=C2=A0I do what I=
 do for my own curiosity, I know it works and I can show it works for spiri=
t communication, but I ain't jumpin' through anyone's hoops! Not for scienc=
e, or any other religion!
=C2=A0
=C2=A0Frank-S


On Mon, May 4, 2009 at 11:=
13 AM, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:












Frank =E2=80=93 I think =
I disagree with you here.=C2=A0 Science is not just about the evidence, it=
=E2=80=99s about the entire process, including how the evidence is collecte=
d and how (and by whom) it is interpreted.=C2=A0 This is why a valuable too=
l in the scientific arsenal is the double (and triple) blind study.=C2=A0 I=
t attempts to remove the often uncontrollable subjectivity inherent in all =
people, even scientists!=C2=A0 Science uses this technique to help keep eve=
n itself as honest as possible.=C2=A0 So if you are finding that the eviden=
ce is being ignored, the reason may not be the evidence itself (no matter h=
ow compelling). It may very well be the manner in which it is collected, an=
d interpreted: all at least as important as the audio itself.


EVP=E2=80=
=99s are perfectly allowed to throw monkey wrenches, and even kitchen sinks=
 into scientific theories and accepted dogmas: but only if they follow scie=
nce=E2=80=99s rules.=C2=A0 It=E2=80=99s like trying to put a new medicine o=
n the market with claims that it destroys accepted dogmas: but, if the test=
ing has not been rigorous and up to accepted medical standards, its hard to=
 blame consumers for being doubtful of its claims.


Science is not magic: =
it is a simple process really, but it forces a claim to really be solidly c=
onfirmed. It seems to me that, while EVP research has its toe in the water =
of scientific methodology (it is making observations, collecting evidence, =
and making theories), it seems to be obsessed on that phase of science, and=
 not on the hard part: designing and conducting objective tests to conform =
or dismiss the theories.=C2=A0 It seems that so many people are having so m=
uch fun with their audio devices and results, that they are maybe afraid of=
 taking it to the next step of serious testing, maybe because of the risk t=
his testing could destroy their fun.


But they should maybe consider it mi=
ght NOT destroy their fun, but instead that next phase of testing may be ju=
st what the doctors ordered to bring EVP into mainline science: real, scien=
ce-based testing.=C2=A0 I fear the people accepted as the real experts and =
pioneers in this field (like you Frank) will never get any acknowledgement =
of their achievements unless they have are able to move into this next phas=
e.


Science wants you to piss on its fire, Frank.=C2=A0 But you have to go=
 where the fire is.=C2=A0=C2=A0 And the way there is through the entire sci=
entific method, not just the early fun parts, but the hard testing parts.=
=C2=A0 But I understand how difficult that prospect can be, and that it wou=
ld take your focus off the part you seem to like best (experimenting with t=
he equipment).=C2=A0 If you are unable to bring yourself to the testing pha=
se, it might be worth looking at partnering up with others who would focus =
on that part for you?=C2=A0 I think a very dynamic team of people could be =
formed with you focused on the technology creation, and they focused on the=
 more mundane aspects of rigorous blind study testing.=C2=A0 Do you think t=
hat would be valuable to you, and to the field of EVP studies? 

=C2=A0


-=
-- On Mon, 5/4/09, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com> wrote:



Fr=
om: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com>

 People given a grant to do what you all are doing,

To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroup=
s .com
Date: Monday, May 4, 2009, 9:28 AM






=C2=A0It's not that it can'=
t be proven, it's that all evidence is deemed unacceptable- -a convinient w=
ay to make uncompfortable facts go away.=C2=A0 The fact is=C2=A0 most of th=
e EVP evidence pretty much contradicts, or at least throws a monkey wrench =
in many so called scientific theories, and accepted dogma. Even spiritualis=
ts don't accept that there's a technology=C2=A0for spirit communication, wh=
o needs a medium when you've got box?

=C2=A0
=C2=A0To me, it seems science=
 has done little over the last 500 years except proclaim themsles the world=
s only experts and source of all knowledge. All technological advancement i=
s made by people trying an idea to see what works, and running with it, not=
 waiting for peer review BS to tell her it doesn't work. Science is a bunch=
 of fat old men sitting around a fire place in over stuffed chairs telling =
each other how smart they are! They don't want anyone pissing on the fire!
=

=C2=A0
=C2=A0Frank-S





On Mon, May 4, 2009 at 9:20 AM, April Abercrombi=
e <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:













You will never=
 be able to prove your methods scientifically, so why even try to argue wit=
h them? Even if you were able to, they probably still wouldn't believe it.
=
=C2=A0
IMO, who cares? All that matters is that you are getting something o=
ut of it. Besides, maybe it isn't meant to be understood by certain people.=
 I have always held the opinion that we will never scientifically prove any=
thing we do in the paranormal field, and I think that is no accident. I thi=
nk some people will never get anything out of it, while others will excel i=
n their knowledge, but it will be all very personal.

=C2=A0
It's all about=
 what constitutes enough=C2=A0proof for you personally. You have to go with=
 your gut on what is true spirit communication, and what isn't. If no one e=
ver agrees with you, so what?

=C2=A0
April



=C2=A0

=C2=A0I was just sayin'!=C2=A0 So why=
 would anyone in this field completely ignore methods that work, irregardle=
ss of whether science accpts it? That's the thing, say anything and I'm the=
 one being negative. Question these other experts and I'm being negative--o=
n and on. 

=C2=A0
=C2=A0Same old story--don't accept the evidence, don't a=
ccept that that someone-like me-does in fact at least understand what condi=
tions to create to make these communications possible. Yet y'all wonder why=
 I have a case of the ass all the time. All the pompus self proclaimed egot=
isical little dweebs out there chasing the damn fame and fortune--not facts=
.

=C2=A0
=C2=A0I have gotten so much friggn'=C2=A0voices that can't be exp=
lained as anything but spirits/entity communication- -not good enough! 
=C2=
=A0
=C2=A0You hear that crap(any proof...)=C2=A0from every scientist/debunk=
er- -well if the evidence was there we'd be the first to celibrate it-yeah =
right, rihgt after they burned, burried, and debunked it. There is more tha=
n enough evidence--all of it is ignored.=C2=A0=C2=A0

=C2=A0
=C2=A0The stuf=
f is simple-provide something for the enitities to make their voices out of=
 and they will speak, no friggin' mystery, no magic, no secret tecnology, n=
o high priest(ess) needed. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0Frank-S

=C2=A0



On Sun, May 3, =
2009 at 7:56 PM, itcdeadpeople <ITCdeadpeople@ aol.com> wrote:












=
Frank, I think you misunderstood or misread something somewhere. The AAEVP/=
Sarah Estep Research Fund is not for AAEVP to do the research, it's for the=
m to fund OUTSIDE organizations for THEIR scientific research on the study =
of EVP. The Windbridge Institute received some of this sponsor money for wh=
at they called "Real-time EVP Conversations: A Pilot Study." The method for=
 this communication was *not* based on radio sweep, nor traditional methods=
, so it's not based on what I assume many people here are doing. And in fac=
t, it *was* based on the creations of someone outside of the USA, so I'm a =
little confused as to why all the hostility toward AAEVP for putting up the=
 money.


Sadly, radio sweep methods don't, and may not for a long time, ge=
t the respect of the scientific community that it deserves (then again, see=
ms no form of EVP does), but at least this current research is a step in th=
e right direction. I hope, when Windbridge concludes their study, that it w=
ill support the notion that there is apparent communication formed in ways =
that cannot be explained by currently known and understood laws of nature. =
THAT alone, in my opinion, would be a big plus for all ITC communities, reg=
ardless of the method from which that communication was received. What's th=
e old saying? "It takes but one white crow to prove all crows are not black=
." Any proof, derived from any EVP method, would be greatly welcomed as far=
 as I'm concerned.


Margaret

<td valign=3D"top">Frank =E2=80=93 I think I disagree with you here.  =
Science is not just about the evidence, it=E2=80=99s about the entire proce=
ss, including how the evidence is collected and how (and by whom) it is int=
erpreted.  This is why a valuable tool in the scientific arsenal is th=
e double (and triple) blind study.  It attempts to remove the often un=
controllable subjectivity inherent in all people, even scientists!  Sc=
ience uses this technique to help keep even itself as honest as possible.&n=
bsp; So if you are finding that the evidence is being ignored, the reason m=
ay not be the evidence itself (no matter how compelling). It may very well =
be the manner in which it is collected, and interpreted: all at least as im=
portant as the audio itself.<br>
<br>EVP=E2=80=99s are perfectly allowed to=
 throw monkey wrenches, and even kitchen sinks into scientific theories and=
 accepted dogmas: but only if they follow science=E2=80=99s rules.  It=
=E2=80=99s like trying to put a new medicine on the market with claims that=
 it destroys accepted dogmas: but, if the testing has not been rigorous and=
 up to accepted medical standards, its hard to blame consumers for being do=
ubtful of its claims.<br>
<br>Science is not magic: it is a simple process =
really, but it forces a claim to really be solidly confirmed. It seems to m=
e that, while EVP research has its toe in the water of scientific methodolo=
gy (it is making observations, collecting evidence, and making theories), i=
t seems to be obsessed on that phase of science, and not on the hard part: =
designing and conducting objective tests to conform or dismiss the theories=
.  It seems that so many people are having so much fun with their audi=
o devices and results, that they are maybe afraid of taking it to the next =
step of serious testing, maybe because of the risk this testing could destr=
oy their fun.<br>
<br>But they should maybe consider it might NOT destroy t=
heir fun, but instead that next phase of testing may be just what the docto=
rs ordered to bring EVP into mainline science: real, science-based testing.=
  I fear the people accepted as the real experts and pioneers in this =
field (like you Frank) will never get any acknowledgement of their achievem=
ents unless they have are able to move into this next phase.<br>
<br>Scienc=
e wants you to piss on its fire, Frank.  But you have to go where the =
fire is.   And the way there is through the entire scientific met=
hod, not just the early fun parts, but the hard testing parts.  But I =
understand how difficult that prospect can be, and that it would take your =
focus off the part you seem to like best (experimenting with the equipment)=
.  If you are unable to bring yourself to the testing phase, it might =
be worth looking at partnering up with others who would focus on that part =
for you?  I think a very dynamic team of people could be formed with y=
ou focused on the technology creation, and they focused on the more mundane=
 aspects of rigorous blind study testing.  Do you think that would be =
valuable to you, and to the field of EVP studies?

p>Frank, I think you misunderstood or misread something somewhere. The AAEV=
P/Sarah Estep Research Fund is not for AAEVP to do the research, it's for t=
hem to fund OUTSIDE organizations for THEIR scientific research on the stud=
y of EVP. The Windbridge Institute received some of this sponsor money for =
what they called "Real-time EVP Conversations: A Pilot Study." The method f=
or this communication was *not* based on radio sweep, nor traditional metho=
ds, so it's not based on what I assume many people here are doing. And in f=
act, it *was* based on the creations of someone outside of the USA, so I'm =
a little confused as to why all the hostility toward AAEVP for putting up t=
he money.<br>
<br>Sadly, radio sweep methods don't, and may not for a long =
time, get the respect of the scientific community that it deserves (then ag=
ain, seems no form of EVP does), but at least this current research is a st=
ep in the right direction. I hope, when Windbridge concludes their study, t=
hat it will support the notion that there is apparent communication formed =
in ways that cannot be explained by currently known and understood laws of =
nature. THAT alone, in my opinion, would be a big plus for all ITC communit=
ies, regardless of the method from which that communication was received. W=
hat's the old saying? "It takes but one white crow to prove all crows are n=
ot black." Any proof, derived from any EVP method, would be greatly welcome=
d as far as I'm concerned.<br>
<br>Margaret </p>
